meanings.sent1: She naturalises easily to new surroundings.

meanings.sent3: The plant naturalises itself in the garden, feeling right at home.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor naturalises any tense situation.

meanings.definition: To adopt or adapt to a new environment or culture
meanings.sent1: He naturalises to the city life after growing up in a small town.
meanings.sent2: The immigrant family naturalises to their new country's customs.
meanings.sent3: The robot naturalises to human behavior, learning to mimic emotions.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter naturalises in the room, spreading joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting naturalises into a beautiful harmony, pleasing the eye.
